Records was made possible by a generous grant from the Henry Luce Foundation.New-York Historical SocietyNew-York Historical Society170 Central Park WestNew York, NY 10024 (212) 873-3400This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2019-10-21T20:17:38Description is in EnglishDescribing Archives: A Content Standard
New-York Historical Society
Time Inc. Real Estate Division Records
Time, inc.
MS 3009-RG 23
7 Linear feet in 6 record cartons, 1 flat box
1960-1980 The Time Inc. Real Estate Division Records contain files on building and land purchases, construction, and alternations for offices and other facilities of Time Inc. and its subsidiaries.
Arrangement Note
Organized alphabetically.
Access Restrictions
Open to qualified researchers with the exception of restricted materials. Restricted materials may include privileged attorney correspondence; personnel performance evaluations; contracts and agreements; and records with personally identifiable information. Restricted materials are located in box R11. Materials created within the past 35 years also may be subject to restriction on a case-by-case basis. Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use.
Use Restrictions
This collection is owned by the New-York Historical Society. Although the N-YHS owns this collection as physical property, the donor specifically retains all copyright and all other proprietary rights which may exist. The copyright law of the United States governs the making of photocopies and protects unpublished materials as well as published materials. Unpublished materials created before January 1, 1978 cannot be quoted in publication without permission of the copyright holder.
Preferred Citation Note
This record group should be cited as Time Inc. Real Estate Division Records, MS 3009-RG 23, New-York Historical Society.
Processing Information Note
The Time Inc. Real Estate Division Records were processed by Holly Deakyne in 2017. When present, the original folders were retained although some documents were transferred to archival containers in instances of overcrowding. The alphabetical arrangement was imposed. Deakyne and Melanie Rinehart created the inventory and other descriptive notes to produce this finding aid.
Related Archival Materials Note
This finding aid relates to just one record group of the Time Inc. Records. For information about the other record groups and for overall information about the archives, please see the Guide to the Time Inc. Records (MS 3009). The Henry Luce Papers (MS 3014) were acquired with the Time Inc. Records. The collection of books acquired with the records are cataloged as the Time Inc. Reference Library. Additional files on Time Inc. office buildings are in Time Inc. Subject Files (MS 3009-RG 1) and Time Inc. Reference Files (MS 3009-RG 3).
Scope and Contents Note
The Time Inc. Real Estate Division Records include files from vice president Peter Hopkins and manager Jerome Justin on building and land purchases, and construction of or alterations to offices, laboratories, warehouses, and other facilities of Time Inc. and its subsidiaries. Records include blueprints and other technical drawings; invoices; interoffice memoranda; inspection reports; estimates; safety code manuals; feasibility studies; correspondence from construction companies and architects; approval letters listing work done; board meeting minutes regarding construction; bidder lists; and construction specifications. Companies that Time Inc. worked with on building projects include J. Robert Carlton and Associates and Carl M. Geupel Construction Company.
Provenance
Gift of Time Inc. in 2015.
